New in and children's reading ideas

April is Suffolk Libraries Children's Month, a celebration of everything we offer children and young adults. Find out more →

Reviews, suggestions and lists of new books for children aged 0-11. We have recommendations for readers aged 11+ in our Young Adult section.

New children's books for January 2019

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 28, 2018

Celebrate Chinese New Year, follow animals in search of a hug, get inspired by famous figures and more.

Mince Spies, by Mark Sperring & Sophie Corrigan

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 24, 2018

Today's book is Mince Spies, by Mark Sperring & Sophie Corrigan.

Little Robin Red Vest, by Jan Fearnley

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 23, 2018

Today's book is Little Robin Red Vest, by Jan Fearnley.

Busy Elves, by Lindsay Dale-Scott

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 22, 2018

Today's book is Busy Elves, by Lindsay Dale-Scott.

Are You There Little Reindeer?, by Sam Taplin & Essi Kimpimäki

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 21, 2018

Today's book is Are You There Little Reindeer?, by Sam Taplin & Essi Kimpimäki.

Check out the Excelsior Award White shortlist for 9-11 year-olds

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 20, 2018

This year, the Excelsior Awards for graphic novels have been split up by age group. Why not reserve a brilliant comic title for 9-11 year-olds today?

Santa's Wonderful Workshop, by Elys Dolan

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 20, 2018

Today's book is Santa's Wonderful Workshop, by Elys Dolan.

Check out the latest super-readable titles from Barrington Stoke

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 19, 2018

New titles optimised for children with dyslexia and visual stress from Gillian Cross, Malorie Blackman, Nicola Davies and more.

Pick a Pine Tree, by Patricia Toht & Jarvis

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 19, 2018

Today's book is Pick a Pine Tree, by Patricia Toht & Jarvis.

The Dog that Saved Christmas, by Nicola Davies & Mike Byrne

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 18, 2018

The Dog that Saved Christmas, by Nicola Davies & Mike Byrne.

More Children's books

  • Brandon Library choose: The Twits, by Roald Dahl & Quentin Blake
  • Woodbridge and Lowestoft libraries choose: Tom's Midnight Garden, by Philippa Pearce
  • Bury St Edmunds Library choose: The Secret Garden, by Frances Hodgson Burnett
  • Haverhill Library choose: Oi Dog!, by Kes & Claire Grey & Jim Field
  • Aldeburgh Library choose: Another Year of Plumdog, by Emma Chichester Clark
  • Check out a brilliant children's book from the 2019 Little Rebels Award shortlist
  • Mildenhall Library choose: The Wonky Donkey, by Craig Smith & Katz Cowley
  • Framlingham Library choose: Owl Babies, by Martin Waddell & Patrick Benson
  • Hadleigh Library choose: The Cat in the Hat, by Dr Seuss
  • Halesworth Library choose: Potkin and Stubbs, by Sophie Green & Karl James Mountford
